topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55371a8d63687261ccf90c00#post_55371a8d63687261ccf90c00
[bq="EHAN"]"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5537197663687261ccfa0a00#post_5537197663687261ccfa0a00
I never said I didn't wanna watch AoT or FLCL, in fact I'm very interested in both series, just unmotivated to start.

I made a bet with Toski to see if he could get through Nichijou, and if he did then I would watch AoT/FLCL. I mean I was gonna watch them anyways, but I just wanted to see if he could do it. I don't really care if he doesn't though, now I get to see what I've missed.

Starting with FLCL though because it's shorter and I have the time right now to get through it.[/bq]
Well, the more you know.
Have a good one.
topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55371dc263687241e9930500#post_55371dc263687241e9930500
Cause it was massively anti-climactic and didn't fit the tone of the series at all.

It would be like if Optimus Prime defeated Megatron using the Elements of Harmony or if Harry Potter defeated Voldemort with a gun in the graveyard.

It was a good show, but god that ending was terrible.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55371ca66368727eb0410d00#post_55371ca66368727eb0410d00
I'm with EHAN. He's stubborn, but he won't disavow me over a goddamn anime show.

I've know him since the day after he was born. We're going to agree and disagree on things we like or don't like. For instance, we constantly argue why our favorite of the Mane Six is best pony.

And we refuse to listen to each other's logic, even if it is sound.

How did it no fit the tone? The entire point of Soul Eater was abstract concepts like insanity and fear being over powered by other simple concepts. It was like Anti-Lovecraft.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55371e7a63687204dac20000#post_55371e7a63687204dac20000
Cause it was a massive deus ex machina out of fucking nowhere to wrap up the story that was never fully explained.  They just went "lol courage!  The end!"

Imagine if say for the Jurassic Park the entire movie was good and the finale was that the dinosaur broke into the visitor shelter with him chowing down on every visitor and all of a sudden a scientist handed the guard a tranquilizer and went "this tranquilizer should knock the dinosaur out"

Deus Ex Machinas make for terrible endings to action shows.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55371f9b63687204da4c0200#post_55371f9b63687204da4c0200
Soul Eater is a series in which concepts like insaniy and fear are TANGIBLE and can be studied scientifically. How would the concept of courage be any dfferent? And considering the concept of courage over-powering insanity and fear was alluded to for the last ten episodes I'd hardly call it a deus ex machina.

topics.body:
My dad just showed me a video about how a teacher would punish his student for coming late everyday. One day, he decided to find the cause of this and noticed how the student was really poor that he had to share his school uniform with his little brother. The teacher then felt sorry and didn't punish him afterwards and decided to help.

My dad says it's sad and touching but I'm only thinking "Why didn't you tell the goddamn truth?! Why didn't you ask for assistance?! The hell is wrong with you, kid?!"

Does that make me a bad person?
